txt.en: Was that a real fly in there - or just a currant?

You should try one of each type of treat that can be gathered from Treats or Trickery doormats: apple goblins, honey-bears, liquorice twists, Midgewater marshmallows, jam tarts, mint turtles, mad Baggins' gold, and Ent-bark.
Hobbit children hold that there is a real midge hidden in every one.
A secret medley of Shire berries. Sticky fingers, guaranteed.
Not too minty, and the nuts inside are superb.
You donned the costume and went from door to neighbourhood door. But have you tasted each kind of treat?
What began as a bit of a joke became, over time, one of the Harvest Festival's most prized treats.
Of course it isn't made of actual Ents! Don't believe everything Prisca Boffin's children tell you.
An apple, baked until soft and sweet, then imaginitively decorated.
Based on third-party accounts of the Beornings' famed honey-cakes, these bear but the slightest resemblance.
Many assume 'twist' describes what one's mouth does upon tasting these.
DNT Anyone dedicated to Treats or Trickery must wish to know what all the flavours of treat taste like.
Treats or Trickery: Just a Taste
